The unreality of the pastoral life in the Eclogues does not indeed prove the existence of similar unreality in the Georgics Í¾ but it prepares us to expect, it. Probably there is no passage in the Georgics in which sympathy with nature is more strongly expressed than that to which I have already adverted, where he contrasts the vocation of Lucretius with his own.
